name: GitBar Launch Plan
description: Production-ready launch of GitBar: distribution setup (Homebrew + DMG + auto-updates), beautiful marketing website, open-source repository preparation, UI redesign, and launch campaign

userStories.title: UI Redesign - Main Interface
userStories.description: Redesign the popover interface to be minimalist and polished like codexbar.app. Focus on proper spacing, hierarchy, and dark mode aesthetics.
acceptanceCriteria: Header with app name and settings icon has proper spacing (16px padding)
Sidebar project list uses consistent spacing (8px between items, 12px padding)
Selected project has subtle highlight (not jarring color)
Git status view uses clear visual hierarchy with proper typography
File list has hover states and consistent icon sizing (16x16px)
All colors follow a cohesive dark mode palette (grays: #1a1a1a, #2a2a2a, #3a3a3a)
Typography is consistent (SF Pro Text, sizes: 13px body, 11px secondary, 15px headers)
Buttons have proper padding and corner radius (6px)
userStories.notes: Use codexbar.app as visual reference. Avoid bright colors, use subtle grays and accent blue (#0A84FF for interactive elements)

userStories.title: UI Redesign - Settings Panel
userStories.description: Create a proper settings panel accessed via gear icon. Move Launch at Login here and add auto-update preferences.
acceptanceCriteria: Settings panel opens as a separate sheet/window (not inline)
Panel sized at 400x300px with proper padding
Launch at Login toggle with clear label and description
Auto-update settings: Check for updates automatically (toggle) + Check now button
About section showing app version and GitHub link
Settings persist in UserDefaults
Panel has clean layout with section headers
Close button or ESC to dismiss
userStories.notes: Settings should feel native macOS. Use Form/Section/Toggle SwiftUI components

userStories.title: Codex Projects Auto-Discovery
userStories.description: Add support for auto-discovering Codex projects in addition to Claude Code projects. Scan ~/.codex/projects/ directory.
acceptanceCriteria: Scan both ~/.claude/projects/ and ~/.codex/projects/ directories
Use same JSONL parsing logic to extract cwd from Codex project folders
Projects from both sources shown in unified sidebar list
Visual indicator or label showing project source (Claude/Codex badge)
Gracefully handle if ~/.codex/ doesn't exist
No duplicate projects if same repo appears in both Claude and Codex
userStories.notes: Codex uses identical folder structure to Claude Code, so reuse existing logic

userStories.title: Logo Design
userStories.description: Design a professional app icon and logo for GitBar. Should work at all sizes (16x16 to 512x512) and match minimalist aesthetic.
acceptanceCriteria: App icon designed in Sketch/Figma with all required sizes (1024x1024 master)
Icon uses git branch symbol or creative interpretation of git + menu bar
Works in both light and dark menu bar backgrounds
Exported to .icns format and added to Assets.xcassets
Icon follows macOS Big Sur+ design language (rounded square, gradient optional)
SVG logo variant created for website use
Menubar icon (16x16, 32x32 @2x) is clear and recognizable
userStories.notes: Use SF Symbols as starting point. Consider hiring designer on Fiverr if needed (~$50). Otherwise use Figma template.

userStories.title: Code Signing and Notarization
userStories.description: Set up proper code signing with Apple Developer certificate and notarization for Gatekeeper approval.
acceptanceCriteria: Developer ID Application certificate installed in Keychain
Xcode project configured with correct signing team and certificate
App bundle signed with hardened runtime enabled
Entitlements file includes necessary permissions (file access, etc)
Notarization script created using notarytool
Build script that signs, notarizes, and staples the app
Verified app opens without warnings on fresh Mac
userStories.notes: Use xcrun notarytool. Store credentials in Keychain. Document process in BUILD.md

userStories.title: Sparkle Auto-Update Integration
userStories.description: Integrate Sparkle 2 framework for automatic app updates. Configure update feed and release workflow.
acceptanceCriteria: Sparkle 2 framework integrated via Swift Package Manager
SUUpdater configured in app with update interval (check daily)
Appcast XML file structure defined and hosted on GitHub
Settings panel includes: Check for updates automatically (toggle) + Check now (button)
Update includes release notes from GitHub releases
EdDSA signature generated and verified for updates
Test update flow from v1.0.0 to v1.0.1 works
userStories.notes: Host appcast.xml in GitHub releases. Use generate_appcast tool from Sparkle

userStories.title: DMG Creation and Distribution
userStories.description: Create a beautiful DMG installer with drag-to-Applications UX. Automate DMG creation in build process.
acceptanceCriteria: DMG created using create-dmg or dmgbuild tool
DMG shows app icon + Applications folder shortcut
Custom DMG background image with installation instructions
DMG is signed and notarized
DMG filename format: GitBar-v1.0.0.dmg
Build script generates DMG as part of release process
DMG tested on clean macOS 13+ installation
userStories.notes: Use create-dmg: brew install create-dmg. Keep DMG under 10MB

userStories.title: Homebrew Cask Setup
userStories.description: Create Homebrew cask formula and submit to homebrew-cask repository for easy installation.
acceptanceCriteria: Cask formula created (gitbar.rb) with correct download URL, SHA256, version
Formula includes auto-update block pointing to Sparkle appcast
Caveats added explaining the app is menubar-only (no Dock icon)
Local testing: brew install --cask gitbar works
Fork homebrew-cask repo and submit PR with formula
Document Homebrew installation in README
userStories.notes: Wait for LAUNCH-007 (DMG). Host DMG on GitHub Releases. Update formula for each release

userStories.title: Open Source Repository Preparation
userStories.description: Prepare the GitBar repository for open source release with proper documentation, license, and structure.
acceptanceCriteria: MIT License file added to repository root
Comprehensive README.md with: description, features, screenshots, installation, usage, building from source
CONTRIBUTING.md with: code style, PR process, issue templates (not seeking contributions but documenting process)
CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (Contributor Covenant)
BUILD.md with detailed build instructions for developers
GitHub issue templates for bug reports and feature requests
Repository description and topics configured (swift, macos, git, menubar-app)
Social preview image (1280x640) set for GitHub
userStories.notes: Use standard templates from GitHub. Include gif/screenshots in README (create with Kap or Licecap)

userStories.title: Marketing Website - Setup and Structure
userStories.description: Create a separate Next.js website repository for gitbar.app marketing site. Set up Vercel deployment and basic structure.
acceptanceCriteria: New GitHub repository created: gitbar-website
Next.js 14+ initialized with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS
Vercel project created and connected to repository
Custom domain configured (gitbar.app or gitbar.dev - document which to purchase)
Dark mode only (remove light mode toggle)
Basic folder structure: app/, components/, public/
Vercel Analytics integrated
OG image configured for social sharing
Site deploys successfully to Vercel
userStories.notes: Keep it simple. Single page app. Use Next.js App Router. Domain ~$12/year from Namecheap

userStories.title: Marketing Website - Design and Content
userStories.description: Build the one-page marketing website inspired by codexbar.app aesthetic. Minimalist, dark, focused on value proposition.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section: App icon, tagline, primary CTA (Download for macOS)
Features section: 3-4 key features with icons and descriptions
Screenshot/demo section showing the app interface
Installation section: Homebrew one-liner + DMG download button
Footer: GitHub link, Twitter/X, version number
Responsive design (mobile friendly)
Fast page load (<1s, optimized images)
Download buttons link to latest GitHub release
All copy is concise and benefit-focused
userStories.notes: Study codexbar.app closely. Use Inter or SF Pro font. Keep color palette minimal: grays + one accent color

userStories.title: Release Automation and Versioning
userStories.description: Create GitHub Actions workflow for automated releases. Tag, build, sign, notarize, create DMG, upload to GitHub Releases, update appcast.
acceptanceCriteria: GitHub Actions workflow (.github/workflows/release.yml)
Triggered on git tag push (v1.0.0 format)
Workflow steps: checkout, build with xcodebuild, sign, notarize, create DMG, generate appcast
Upload DMG to GitHub Release with release notes
Update appcast.xml in repository
Secrets configured in GitHub: APPLE_ID, APPLE_APP_SPECIFIC_PASSWORD, signing certificate
Version number in Xcode matches git tag
Test workflow with v1.0.0-beta1 tag
userStories.notes: Use fastlane or custom scripts. Store certificates in GitHub Secrets. Document manual release process as backup

userStories.title: Launch Assets and Campaign Prep
userStories.description: Prepare all assets and content for Product Hunt and Twitter/X launch.
acceptanceCriteria: Product Hunt: 3-5 screenshots showing key features, demo GIF (10-15 seconds), product description, tagline
Twitter/X: Launch thread drafted (3-5 tweets), screenshot/GIF attached, hashtags selected
Press kit created: logo files (SVG, PNG), screenshots, app description, contact info
Launch checklist created: timing, accounts to notify, response templates for comments
Analytics/tracking ready: GitHub stars, website visits, download count
Community response plan: how to handle feedback, feature requests, bugs
userStories.notes: Product Hunt: launch on Tuesday/Wednesday for max visibility. Prepare maker account. Draft engaging story about why you built this
userStories.completionNotes: Complete launch package created in launch-assets/ directory. Includes: Product Hunt submission guide with tagline/description/screenshot specs, Twitter 5-tweet launch thread with hashtag strategy, comprehensive press kit with logos (all sizes), launch checklist with hour-by-hour timeline, analytics tracking plan with metrics dashboard, community response plan with templates for all scenarios. Ready for launch - just need to create screenshots and demo GIF following the detailed guides provided.

userStories.title: Pre-Launch Testing and Polish
userStories.description: Comprehensive testing on fresh machines. Fix any critical bugs. Final polish pass on UI and UX.
acceptanceCriteria: Test on clean macOS 13, 14, 15 installations (use VM or borrow device)
Test first-run experience (no projects, empty states)
Test all Git operations: stage, unstage, commit, push, pull
Test with 1, 5, 20+ projects (performance)
Test auto-updates (simulate update from v1.0.0 to v1.0.1)
Test Homebrew installation on clean machine
Fix any visual bugs or layout issues
Verify all links work (GitHub, website, etc)
Get 2-3 people to try the app and provide feedback
userStories.notes: Use Feedback Assistant or TestFlight for beta testing. Document known issues in GitHub Issues

dependencies: Time for design/logo (DIY or ~$50 on Fiverr)
